intro: Castilleja nana, commonly known as dwarf paintbrush, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant has slender, erect stems and is characterized by its showy, red to orange tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate and often reduced, with a hairy texture. Castilleja nana typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
